abstract: The world is witness to a big game of chicken, and this is likely to lead to a negotiated settlement.
snippet: The world is witness to a big game of chicken, and this is likely to lead to a negotiated settlement.
lead_paragraph: Margaret Thatcher once said the markets can’t be bucked; Angela Merkel, by contrast, believes in the “primacy of politics.” Who’s right depends on whether politicians have the will to change the unpleasant reality that markets can reflect. The euro crisis is a test for these two approaches.

headline.main: In Euro Crisis, Politics and Markets Collide
headline.print_headline:
REUTERS BREAKINGVIEWS; Markets Collide
With Politics
